Definition.WordDefinition:
Hotness \Hot"ness\, n. 1. The quality or state of being hot. [1913 Webster]
2. Heat or excitement of mind or manner; violence; vehemence; impetuousity; ardor; fury. --M. Arnold. [1913 Webster]
hotness n 1: the presence of heat [syn: {heat}, {high temperature}] [ant: {coldness}] 2: a state of sexual arousal [syn: {horniness}, {hot pants}] 3: a hot spiciness [syn: {pepperiness}]
